2. Sock and Buskin - Retriggers all played face cards
3. Wrathful Joker - +3 Mult per spade card scored
4. Business Card - Money from face cards
5. Abstract Joker - +15 Mult constant

**Analysis:**

I just used The Chariot to enhance a card into a Steel Card (x1.5 Mult while it stays in hand). This is a great permanent boost to my mult.

Now I'm back in the shop with $9 remaining.

Options:
1. The Hanged Man ($3) - Destroys up to 2 selected cards. Could thin my deck.


2. Marble Joker ($6) - Adds one Stone card to deck when Blind is selected. But I have no joker slots available.
3. Reroll shop ($5) - Look for better options

The Marble Joker is tempting for its chip boost, but I'd need to sacrifice one of my current jokers. Zany Joker drives my Three of a Kind strategy, Sock and Buskin multiplies face cards, and Wrathful Joker scales with spades. Business Card generates money, which is less critical right now. The real question is whether a Stone card's passive chip generation outweighs losing one of these active effects.

Stone cards give +50 chips but can't form hand types themselves—they're pure chip value without interfering with my hand composition. With Ante 3 approaching and my Three of a Kind still at Level 1, I need to weigh whether that extra chip value justifies the joker slot trade-off.

The Hanged Man could thin my deck for consistency, but with only $9 and needing flexibility for future rounds, I'm better off banking my money and letting interest build. I'll proceed to the next round and reassess with a larger budget.

Steel gives me a solid x1.5 mult multiplier when in play, so my joker lineup is strong enough to carry through the round. I'll earn more money from interest and leftover hands, then have better purchasing power at the next shop phase.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.
